H0.text: The long neck on a giraffe is a behavioral adaptation that helps the organism to survive, as Perry studies the ways in which animals are adapted for survival.

H1.text: The webbed feet on a duck are a behavioral adaptation that helps the organism to survive, as identified by Perry in his study of the ways in which animals are adapted for survival.

H2.text: A bear hibernating in winter is a behavioral adaptation that helps organisms survive, as Perry studies animal adaptations for survival.

H3.text: A flower attracting a honeybee is a behavioral adaptation that helps the organism to survive, as described in Perryâ€™s study of how animals are adapted for survival.

A4.text: Hibernation functions to conserve energy when sufficient food is not available.
